title: summaryByVisit
text: demonstrate various functionalities function, create small dataset. three hypotetical lab-values: LDH, ANC Lymphocytes. lab-value measured 10 time points (visits), can divided three visit groups (baseline, treatment follow-). addition, grouping variable called ‘arm’.
code: data<-NULL visit <- c(paste0(rep("Visit ", 10), rbind(c(1:10))),            paste0(rep("Visit ", 10), rbind(c(1:10))),            paste0(rep("Visit ", 10), rbind(c(1:10)))) data <- as.data.frame(cbind( visit, rnorm(30))) data<-as.data.frame(rbind(data, data, data, data, data)) data$visitgroup<- ifelse(data$visit %in% c("Visit 1", "Visit 2"), "Baseline", ifelse(data$visit %in% c("Visit 3", "Visit 4"), "Treatment", "Follow-up")) data$visitgroup<-factor(data$visitgroup, levels = c("Baseline", "Treatment", "Follow-up")) data$LDH<-rnorm(150) data$Lymphocytes<-rnorm(150) data$ANC<-rnorm(150) data$LDH[3]<-NA data$arm<- c(rep("Arm A", 70), rep("Arm B", 80))

title: summaryByVisit
code: summaryByVisit(data,          vars = c("LDH", "Lymphocytes", "ANC"),          visit = "visit",           add_n = TRUE)

title: summaryByVisit
text: can visit group group visits accordingly. Visitgroup needs ordered factor. Visit N = 151 LDH  Baseline  Visit 1 0.1 (-1.9, 2.0) Visit 2 0.1 (-1.4, 1.3) Treatment  Visit 3 0.5 (-1.1, 1.9) Visit 4 0.0 (-1.3, 1.6) Follow- Visit 5 0.1 (-1.8, 1.3) Visit 6 0.5 (-1.0, 2.8) Visit 7 -0.5 (-2.6, 1.1) Visit 8 -0.2 (-1.7, 2.7) Visit 9 0.2 (-1.5, 1.3) Visit 10 0.2 (-1.9, 2.2) Lymphocytes  Baseline  Visit 1 -0.3 (-1.2, 1.1) Visit 2 -0.5 (-2.2, 1.4) Treatment  Visit 3 0.0 (-1.7, 1.5) Visit 4 0.1 (-1.8, 1.5) Follow- Visit 5 0.4 (-2.4, 2.1) Visit 6 0.1 (-2.1, 2.0) Visit 7 0.3 (-1.4, 2.2) Visit 8 0.4 (-1.0, 2.6) Visit 9 0.6 (-2.1, 1.9) Visit 10 0.2 (-1.7, 2.6) ANC  Baseline  Visit 1 0.2 (-1.4, 1.8) Visit 2 -0.3 (-2.0, 2.1) Treatment  Visit 3 -0.1 (-1.2, 1.8) Visit 4 -0.5 (-2.2, 1.8) Follow- Visit 5 -0.1 (-2.9, 1.4) Visit 6 0.6 (-2.1, 2.0) Visit 7 -0.6 (-1.7, 0.6) Visit 8 -0.4 (-1.9, 2.1) Visit 9 0.1 (-0.7, 1.5) Visit 10 0.2 (-1.8, 1.2) 1Median (Min, Max)
code: summaryByVisit(data,          vars = c("LDH", "Lymphocytes", "ANC"),          visitgroup = "visitgroup",          visit = "visit")

title: summaryByVisit
code: summaryByVisit(data,          vars = c("LDH", "Lymphocytes", "ANC"),          group = "arm",          visitgroup = "visitgroup",          visit = "visit") summaryByVisit(data,          vars = c("LDH", "Lymphocytes", "ANC"),          group = "arm",          overall = TRUE,          visitgroup = "visitgroup",          visit = "visit")

title: summaryByVisit
code: summaryByVisit(data,          vars = c("LDH", "Lymphocytes", "ANC"),          group = "arm",          overall = TRUE,          visitgroup = "visitgroup",          visit = "visit",          add_n = TRUE)

title: summaryByVisit
text: improve costumization

title: summaryLevels
text: demonstrate various functionalities function, create small dataset. factor interest ‘Site progression’. site progression, presence absence decoded separate column. addition, grouping variable called ‘arm’.
code: data<- as.data.frame(cbind(c(1:10), c("A","A","A","A","A","B","B","B","B","B"),                             c("absent","present","absent","present","absent","absent","present","absent","present","absent"),                             c("absent","absent","present","absent","absent","absent","absent","absent","absent","absent"),                             c("present","absent","present","present","present","present","present","present","present","present"))) names(data)<-c("upn", "arm", "liver", "lung", "brain")

title: summaryLevels
text: Now, use summarySCI::summaryLevels collapse columns ‘liver’, ‘lung’ ‘brain’ single factor named ‘Site progression’. presence site progression decoded ‘present’. need define columns containing factor levels using vars argument. Site progression1 N = 102 liver 4 (40%) lung 1 (10%) brain 9 (90%) 1More one entry possible 2n (%) footnote emphazises patient may one site progression. Therefore, column percentages neccessarily add 100%.
code: summarySCI::summaryLevels(data=data,                       vars = c("liver", "lung", "brain"),                       label = "Site of progression",                       levels= "present",)

title: summaryLevels
text: can stratify table groups via group argument. overall column can still shown desired, using overall = TRUE argument. Site progression1  N = 52 B  N = 52 liver 2 (40%) 2 (40%) lung 1 (20%) 0 (0%) brain 4 (80%) 5 (100%) 1More one entry possible 2n (%) Site progression1 Overall  N = 102  N = 52 B  N = 52 liver 4 (40%) 2 (40%) 2 (40%) lung 1 (10%) 1 (20%) 0 (0%) brain 9 (90%) 4 (80%) 5 (100%) 1More one entry possible 2n (%)
code: summarySCI::summaryLevels(data=data,                       vars = c("liver", "lung", "brain"),                       group = "arm",                       label = "Site of progression",                       levels= "present") summarySCI::summaryLevels(data=data,                       vars = c("liver", "lung", "brain"),                       group = "arm",                       label = "Site of progression",                       levels= "present",                       overall = TRUE)

title: summaryLevels
text: statistical test can performed level separately argument test set TRUE. type test can changed test_cat argument. Options include chisq.test, chisq.test..correct, fisher.test (default) Site progression1  N = 52 B  N = 52 p-value3 liver 2 (40%) 2 (40%) >0.99 lung 1 (20%) 0 (0%) >0.99 brain 4 (80%) 5 (100%) >0.99 1More one entry possible 2n (%) 3Fisher's exact test Site progression1  N = 52 B  N = 52 p-value3 liver 2 (40%) 2 (40%) >0.99 lung 1 (20%) 0 (0%) >0.99 brain 4 (80%) 5 (100%) >0.99 1More one entry possible 2n (%) 3Pearson's Chi-squared test
code: summarySCI::summaryLevels(data=data,                       vars = c("liver", "lung", "brain"),                       group = "arm",                       label = "Site of progression",                       test = TRUE,,                       levels= "present") summarySCI::summaryLevels(data=data,                       vars = c("liver", "lung", "brain"),                       group = "arm",                       levels= "present",                       label = "Site of progression",                       test = TRUE,                       test_cat = "chisq.test") #> The following warnings were returned during `add_p()`: #> ! For variable `liver` (`arm`) and "statistic", "p.value", and "parameter" #>   statistics: Chi-squared approximation may be incorrect #> The following warnings were returned during `add_p()`: #> ! For variable `lung` (`arm`) and "statistic", "p.value", and "parameter" #>   statistics: Chi-squared approximation may be incorrect #> The following warnings were returned during `add_p()`: #> ! For variable `brain` (`arm`) and "statistic", "p.value", and "parameter" #>   statistics: Chi-squared approximation may be incorrect

title: summaryLevels
text: confidence interval can added, requested using statement ci = TRUE. confidence level can adjusted conf_level. type confidence interval can chosen using command ci_cat. Site progression1  N = 52 90% CI B  N = 52 90% CI p-value3 liver 2 (40%) [9.0%, 80%] 2 (40%) [9.0%, 80%] >0.99 lung 1 (20%) [1.4%, 65%] 0 (0%) [0.00%, 47%] >0.99 brain 4 (80%) [35%, 99%] 5 (100%) [53%, 100%] >0.99 1More one entry possible 2n (%) 3Fisher's exact test Abbreviation: CI = Confidence Interval
code: summarySCI::summaryLevels(data=data,                       vars = c("liver", "lung", "brain"),                       group = "arm",                       label = "Site of progression",                       levels= "present",                       test = TRUE,                       test_cat = "fisher.test",                       ci=TRUE,                       conf_level = 0.9,                       overall = FALSE)

title: summaryLevels
text: make possible stack tables

title: summaryTable
text: demonstrate various functionalities function use dataset survival::colon. dataset colon contains data 1858 patients one first successful trials adjuvant chemotherapy colon cancer. simplicity, focus recurrence , two treatment groups, four variable: treatment group (rx), sex (Male), age (age) extent local spread (extent). also add missing values variable extent.
code: library(survival) data(cancer, package="survival")  colon1 <-  colon %>%   group_by(id) %>%   slice(1) %>% # Select the first row within each id group   ungroup() set.seed(123) colon2 <- colon1 %>%   select(rx, sex, age, extent) %>%   filter(rx != "Lev") %>%   mutate(rx = if_else(rx == "Obs", "Control", rx),          extent = if_else(row_number() %in% sample(row_number(), size = round(0.1 * n())), NA, extent)) %>%    rename(Male = sex) %>%    mutate(extent = as.factor(extent)) head(colon2) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   rx       Male   age extent #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <fct>  #> 1 Lev+5FU     1    43 3      #> 2 Lev+5FU     1    63 3      #> 3 Control     0    71 2      #> 4 Lev+5FU     0    66 3      #> 5 Control     1    69 3      #> 6 Lev+5FU     0    57 3

title: summaryTable
text: default, function produces table variables present dataset. Characteristic N N = 6191 rx 619  Control  315 (51%) Lev+5FU  304 (49%) Male 619  0  312 (50%) 1  307 (50%) age 619 61.0 (18.0, 85.0) extent 557  1  17 (3%) 2  68 (11%) 3  446 (72%) 4  26 (4%) Missing  62 (10%) 1n (%); Median (Min, Max) specific variables included, need entered argument vars. argument group allows summary statistics stratified variable. Characteristic N1 Control  N = 3152 N1 Lev+5FU  N = 3042 Male 315  304  0  149 (47%)  163 (54%) 1  166 (53%)  141 (46%) age 315 60.0 (18.0, 85.0) 304 62.0 (26.0, 81.0) extent 285  272  1  8 (3%)  9 (3%) 2  38 (12%)  30 (10%) 3  222 (70%)  224 (74%) 4  17 (5%)  9 (3%) Missing  30 (10%)  32 (11%) 1N without missing values 2n (%); Median (Min, Max)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2) summaryTable(data = colon2,               vars = c("Male", "age", "extent"),               group = "rx")

title: summaryTable
text: displayed name variable label exists dataset, variable name label present dataset (case example). order customize displayed name, argument labels can used. Please note labels need entered list, shown : Characteristic N1 Control  N = 3152 N1 Lev+5FU  N = 3042 Male 315  304  0  149 (47%)  163 (54%) 1  166 (53%)  141 (46%) Age 315 60.0 (18.0, 85.0) 304 62.0 (26.0, 81.0) Extent 285  272  1  8 (3%)  9 (3%) 2  38 (12%)  30 (10%) 3  222 (70%)  224 (74%) 4  17 (5%)  9 (3%) Missing  30 (10%)  32 (11%) 1N without missing values 2n (%); Median (Min, Max)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",              labels = list(age = "Age", extent = "Extent"))

title: summaryTable
text: number observations missing values default added new column. can disabled setting argument add_n FALSE. Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Male   0 149 (47%) 163 (54%) 1 166 (53%) 141 (46%) Age 60.0 (18.0, 85.0) 62.0 (26.0, 81.0) Extent   1 8 (3%) 9 (3%) 2 38 (12%) 30 (10%) 3 222 (70%) 224 (74%) 4 17 (5%) 9 (3%) Missing 30 (10%) 32 (11%) 1n (%); Median (Min, Max)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",             labels = list(rx = "Arm", age = "Age", extent = "Extent"),               add_n = FALSE)

title: summaryTable
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",              overall = TRUE,               labels = list(age = "Age", extent = "Extent"))

title: summaryTable
text: function gtsummary::tbl_summary considers numeric variables fewer 10 unique values categorical default. case function summaryTable. Per default, numeric variables considered continuous, unless two unique values: 0 1. case, considered dichotomous. can changed setting argument continuous_as categorical. dichotomous variables, levels displayed default. show one row, use argument dichotomous_as = dichotomous. reference level specified using argument value = list(variable ~ "level show"). Characteristic N1 Control  N = 3152 N1 Lev+5FU  N = 3042 Male 315 166 (53%) 304 141 (46%) 1N without missing values 2n (%) default, function plots median range continuous variables. number options available, using argument stat_cont.
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,              group = "rx",              vars = "Male",             labels = list(age = "Age"),              dichotomous_as = "dichotomous",              value = list(Male ~ "1"),             missing = FALSE)

title: summaryTable
text: statistics displayed can chosen using argument stat_cont (options: median_IQR, median_range (default), "mean_sd", "mean_se" "geomMean_sd") stat_cat (options: "n_percent" (default) "n" "n_N"). Characteristic N1 Control  N = 3152 N1 Lev+5FU  N = 3042 Male 315  304  0  149/315  163/304 1  166/315  141/304 Age 315 60.0 (53.0, 68.0) 304 62.0 (52.0, 70.0) Extent 285  272  1  8/315  9/304 2  38/315  30/304 3  222/315  224/304 4  17/315  9/304 Missing  30/315  32/304 1N without missing values 2n/N; Median (Q1, Q3)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2, group = "rx",               stat_cont = "median_IQR",               stat_cat = "n_N",               labels = list(age = "Age", sex = "Sex", extent = "Extent"))

title: summaryTable
text: default, p-value confidence (CI) displayed. p-values can added setting test TRUE CI setting ci TRUE. default test type continuous variable wilcox.test, fisher.test categorical variables. can changed test_cont test_cat, respectively. default CI type continuous variables wilcox.test wilson categorical variables. can changed ci_cont ci_cat, respectively. Characteristic N1 Control  N = 3152 95% CI N1 Lev+5FU  N = 3042 95% CI p-value3 Age 315 59.5 (12.0) [59, 62] 304 59.7 (12.3) [59, 62] 0.60 Extent 285   272   0.37 1  8 (3%) [1.2%, 5.1%]  9 (3%) [1.5%, 5.7%]  2  38 (12%) [8.8%, 16%]  30 (10%) [6.9%, 14%]  3  222 (70%) [65%, 75%]  224 (74%) [68%, 78%]  4  17 (5%) [3.3%, 8.7%]  9 (3%) [1.5%, 5.7%]  Missing  30 (10%) [6.6%, 13%]  32 (11%) [7.4%, 15%]  1N without missing values 2Mean (SD); n (%) 3Wilcoxon rank sum test; Fisher's exact test Abbreviation: CI = Confidence Interval
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = c("age", "extent"),               stat_cont = "mean_sd",               test = TRUE,              ci = TRUE,              labels = list(age = "Age", extent = "Extent")              ) #> The number rows in the tables to be merged do not match, which may result in #> rows appearing out of order. #> ℹ See `tbl_merge()` (`?gtsummary::tbl_merge()`) help file for details. Use #>   `quiet=TRUE` to silence message.

title: summaryTable
text: Per default, missing values shown separate category. can disabled setting missing FALSE. missing = TRUE, percentage automatically added next missing number. can disabled setting argument missing_percentage FALSE. Characteristic N1 Control  N = 3152 95% CI N1 Lev+5FU  N = 3042 95% CI p-value3 Extent 285   272   0.37 1  8 (3%) [1.3%, 5.7%]  9 (3%) [1.6%, 6.4%]  2  38 (13%) [9.7%, 18%]  30 (11%) [7.7%, 16%]  3  222 (78%) [73%, 82%]  224 (82%) [77%, 87%]  4  17 (6%) [3.6%, 9.6%]  9 (3%) [1.6%, 6.4%]  Missing  30   32   1N without missing values 2n (%) 3Fisher's exact test Abbreviation: CI = Confidence Interval Characteristic N1 Control  N = 3152 95% CI N1 Lev+5FU  N = 3042 95% CI p-value3 Extent 285   272   0.37 1  8 (3%) [1.2%, 5.1%]  9 (3%) [1.5%, 5.7%]  2  38 (12%) [8.8%, 16%]  30 (10%) [6.9%, 14%]  3  222 (70%) [65%, 75%]  224 (74%) [68%, 78%]  4  17 (5%) [3.3%, 8.7%]  9 (3%) [1.5%, 5.7%]  Missing  30 (10%) [6.6%, 13%]  32 (11%) [7.4%, 15%]  1N without missing values 2n (%) 3Fisher's exact test Abbreviation: CI = Confidence Interval tables without missing values can also put next setting missing "".  missing Without missing  Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 p-value2 Extent     0.37 1 8 (3%) 9 (3%) 8 (3%) 9 (3%)  2 38 (12%) 30 (10%) 38 (13%) 30 (11%)  3 222 (70%) 224 (74%) 222 (78%) 224 (82%)  4 17 (5%) 9 (3%) 17 (6%) 9 (3%)  Missing 30 (10%) 32 (11%)    1n (%) 2Fisher's exact test
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "extent",               test = TRUE,              ci = TRUE,              missing_percent = FALSE,              labels = list(extent = "Extent")              ) summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "extent",               test = TRUE,              ci = TRUE,              missing_percent = TRUE,              labels = list(extent = "Extent")              ) #> The number rows in the tables to be merged do not match, which may result in #> rows appearing out of order. #> ℹ See `tbl_merge()` (`?gtsummary::tbl_merge()`) help file for details. Use #>   `quiet=TRUE` to silence message. summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "extent",               missing_percent = "both",               test = TRUE,               labels = list(extent = "Extent")              ) #> The number rows in the tables to be merged do not match, which may result in #> rows appearing out of order. #> ℹ See `tbl_merge()` (`?gtsummary::tbl_merge()`) help file for details. Use #>   `quiet=TRUE` to silence message. #> The number rows in the tables to be merged do not match, which may result in #> rows appearing out of order. #> ℹ See `tbl_merge()` (`?gtsummary::tbl_merge()`) help file for details. Use #>   `quiet=TRUE` to silence message.

title: summaryTable
text: Digits can customized arguments digits_cont digits_cat. argument as_flex_table (default TRUE) converts gtsummary object flextable object, better Word output.

title: summaryTable

title: Produces Publication-Ready Summary Tables

code: devtools::install_github(   repo = "SAKK-Statistics/summarySCI",   dependencies = TRUE )

title: Produces Publication-Ready Summary Tables
text: Currently, package contains three functions: summaryTable() summaryLevels() summaryByVisit()

what: Creates publication-ready summary tables for continuous data grouped, by visit — summaryByVisit
title: Creates publication-ready summary tables for continuous data grouped, by visit — summaryByVisit
text: Creates publication-ready summary tables continuous data grouped, visit

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables for continuous data grouped, by visit — summaryByVisit
code: summaryByVisit(   data,   vars = NULL,   group = NULL,   labels = NULL,   stat_cont = "median_range",   visit = "visit",   order = NULL,   visitgroup = NULL,   digits_cont = 1,   add_n = FALSE,   overall = FALSE,   as_flex_table = TRUE,   border = TRUE,   word_output = FALSE,   file_name = paste0("SummaryByVisit_", format(Sys.Date(), "%Y%m%d"), ".docx") )

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables for continuous data grouped, by visit — summaryByVisit
text: data data frame tibble containing data summarized. vars Continuous variables include summary table. Need specified quotes, e.g. "age" c("age", "response"). Default variables present data except group. group single column data. Need specified quotes, e.g. "treatment". Summary statistics stratified according variable. Default NULL. maximum 3 groups currently supported. labels list containing labels used variables table. NULL, labels automatically taken dataset. label present, variable name taken. stat_cont Summary statistic display continuous variables. Options include "median_IQR", "median_range" (default), "mean_sd", "mean_se" "geomMean_sd". visit Name stratum summary statistics displayed line. Typically, "visit". order numerical variable defining visit order. visitgroup grouping variable stratum summary statistics displayed line. Must ordered factor. Typically, visit group e.g., baseline, follow-etc. digits_cont Digits summary statistics CI continuous variables. Default 1. add_n Logical. TRUE, additional column total number non-missing observations variable added. overall Logical. TRUE, additional column total added table. Ignored, groups defined. Default FALSE. as_flex_table Logical. TRUE (default) gtsummary object converted flextable object. Useful rendering Word. border Logical. TRUE, border drawn around table. available flex_table = TRUE. Default TRUE. word_output Logical. TRUE, table also saved word document. file_name Character string. Specify name Word document containing table. used word_output TRUE. Needs end ".docx".

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables for continuous data grouped, by visit — summaryByVisit
text: table class "flextable" c("tbl_strata_nested_stack", "tbl_stack", "gtsummary"). Optionally returns .docx file specified folder.

title: summaryLevels — summaryLevels
text: Collapses factor levels multiple columns one creates summary table.

title: summaryLevels — summaryLevels
code: summaryLevels(   data,   vars = NULL,   group = NULL,   label = NULL,   levels = NULL,   stat_cat = "n_percent",   test = FALSE,   test_cat = "fisher.test",   ci = FALSE,   ci_cat = "wilson",   conf_level = 0.95,   digits_cat = 0,   overall = FALSE,   as_flex_table = TRUE,   border = TRUE,   word_output = FALSE,   file_name = paste0("SummaryLevels_", format(Sys.Date(), "%Y%m%d"), ".docx") )

title: summaryLevels — summaryLevels
text: data data frame tibble containing data summarized. vars Variables include summary table. Need specified quotes, e.g. "score" c("score", "age_cat"). Default variables present data except group. group single column data. Need specified quotes, e.g. "treatment". Summary statistics stratified according variable. Default NULL. label label new variable created. label present, variable name taken. levels = vector containing values indicating presence factor level. Included default "1", "yes", "Yes". stat_cat Summary statistic display categorical variables. Options include "n_percent" (default) "n", "n_N". test Logical. Indicates whether p-values displayed (TRUE) (FALSE). Default FALSE test_cat Test type used calculated p-value categorical variables.  used test = TRUE. Options include "fisher.test" (default), "chisq.test", "chisq.test..correct". NULL, function decides : "chisq.test..correct" categorical variables expected cell counts >=5, "fisher.test" categorical variables expected cell count <5. ci Logical. Indicates whether CI displayed (TRUE) (FALSE). Default FALSE. ci_cat Confidence interval method categorical variables. Options include "wilson" (default), "wilson..correct", "clopper.pearson", "wald", "wald..correct", "agresti.coull" "jeffreys". NULL, CI displayed. conf_level Numeric. Confidence level. Default 0.95. digits_cat Numeric. Digits summary statistics CI categorical variables. Default 0. overall Logical. TRUE, additional column total added table. Default FALSE. as_flex_table Logical. TRUE (default) gtsummary object converted flextable object. Useful rendering Word. border Logical. TRUE, border drawn around table. available flex_table = TRUE. Default TRUE. word_output Logical. TRUE, table also saved word document. file_name Character string. Specify name Word document containing table. used word_output TRUE. Needs end ".docx".

title: summaryLevels — summaryLevels
text: table class "flextable" c("tbl_stack", "gtsummary"). Optionally returns .docx file specified folder.

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
text: Creates publication-ready summary tables based gtsummary package.

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
code: summaryTable(   data,   vars = NULL,   group = NULL,   labels = NULL,   stat_cont = "median_range",   stat_cat = "n_percent",   continuous_as = "continuous",   dichotomous_as = "dichotomous",   value = NULL,   test = FALSE,   test_cont = "wilcox.test",   test_cat = "fisher.test",   ci = FALSE,   ci_cont = "wilcox.test",   ci_cat = "wilson",   conf_level = 0.95,   digits_cont = 1,   digits_cat = 0,   missing = TRUE,   missing_percent = TRUE,   missing_text = "Missing",   overall = FALSE,   add_n = TRUE,   as_flex_table = TRUE,   border = TRUE,   word_output = FALSE,   file_name = paste0("SummaryTable_", format(Sys.Date(), "%Y%m%d"), ".docx") )

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
text: data data frame tibble containing data summarized. vars Variables include summary table. Need specified quotes, e.g. "age" c("age", "response"). Default variables present data except group. group single column data. Need specified quotes, e.g. "treatment". Summary statistics stratified according variable. Default NULL. labels list containing labels used variables table. NULL, labels automatically taken dataset. label present, variable name taken. stat_cont Summary statistic display continuous variables. Options include "median_IQR", "median_range" (default), "mean_sd", "mean_se" "geomMean_sd". stat_cat Summary statistic display categorical variables. Options include "n_percent" (default) "n", "n_N". continuous_as Type continuous variables. Can either "continous" (default) "categorical". dichotomous_as Type dichotomous variables. Can either "categorical" (default, one row per level) "dichotomous" (one row reference level (see argument value), works missing = "FALSE" missing_percent = FALSE. value Specifies reference level variable display single row. Default NULL. syntax follows: value = list(varname ~ "level show"). test Logical. Indicates whether p-values displayed (TRUE) (FALSE). Default FALSE test_cont Test type used calculate p-value continuous variables. used test = TRUE. Options include "t.test", "oneway.test", "kruskal.test", "wilcox.test" (default), "paired.t.test", "paired.wilcox.test" test_cat Test type used calculated p-value categorical variables.  used test = TRUE. Options include "fisher.test" (default), "chisq.test", "chisq.test..correct". NULL, function decides : "chisq.test..correct" categorical variables expected cell counts >=5, "fisher.test" categorical variables expected cell count <5. ci Logical. Indicates whether CI displayed (TRUE) (FALSE). Default FALSE. ci_cont Confidence interval method continuous variables. used ci = TRUE. Options include "t.test" "wilcox.test" (default). ci_cat Confidence interval method categorical variables. Options include "wilson" (default), "wilson..correct", "clopper.pearson", "wald", "wald..correct", "agresti.coull" "jeffreys". NULL, CI displayed. conf_level Numeric. Confidence level. Default 0.95. digits_cont Numeric. Digits summary statistics CI continuous variables. Default 1. digits_cat Numeric. Digits summary statistics CI categorical variables. Default 0. missing Logical. TRUE (default), missing values shown. missing_percent Indicates whether percentages missings shown (TRUE, default) (FALSE) categorical variables. "", options displayed next . missing_text String indicating text shown missing row. Default "Missing". overall Logical. TRUE, additional column total added table. Default FALSE. add_n Logical. TRUE (default), additional column total number non-missing observations variable added. as_flex_table Logical. TRUE (default) gtsummary object converted flextable object. Useful rendering Word. border Logical. TRUE, border drawn around table. available flex_table = TRUE. Default TRUE. word_output Logical. TRUE, table also saved word document. file_name Character string. Specify name Word document containing table. used word_output TRUE. Needs end ".docx".

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
text: table class "flextable" c("tbl_summary", "gtsummary"). Optionally returns .docx file specified folder.
